result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandin S Hughes

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Defense Motion to Suppress.

Defendant Brandin S Hughes in court.  Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court for Brandin S Hughes.  Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense request a motion hearing date. Court grants the defenses motion. Court order's the State's response to the defenses motion by November 18th, 2022. Case adjourned to Branch 19.
Motion hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Brandin S Hughes in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State and request time to review materal and discuss with client. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 10 pages) commencing 07-14-2022 by Kathleen s. Worden.

Defendant Brandin S Hughes in court with Attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Franklin Officer C. Krakau. Court took judicial notice of 15CF4319. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Brandin S Hughes in court with Student Intern Simon Earle under the supervision of with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood. Student Intern Paul Lasswell under the supervision of Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-28-2022 @1p

Actual Date Bond Posted with the Sheriffs Department:
05/16/22.    22RM025334
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on June 28, 2022 at 1:00 PM.
